extends SolidElement

Method Detail

getColor

public int getColor()
Deprecated. use getReflection

Returns the color of the line. Newer versions should use getReflection() instead.

Returns:
The color of this line.

setReflection

public void setReflection(int level)
Sets the color. This can be based on the colors defined in the Reflective interface, or on the actual amount of reflected light.

Specified by:
setReflection in interface Reflective
Parameters:
level - The color of line.

getReflection

public int getReflection()
Returns the level of reflection of light.

Specified by:
getReflection in interface Reflective
Returns:
The level of reflected light, either as a continuous level, or as one of the Reflective constants.

draw

Draws the colored line in the specified context

Specified by:
draw in interface Collidable
Overrides:
draw in class VisibleElement
Parameters:
g2 - The Graphics2D context.

setColor

protected void setColor(int value)
Sets the color of this line. If the value specified is not one of the standard constants, a grayscale line will be created using the parameter as the level of gray.

Parameters:
value - The color of the line, from the ReflectiveColors constants; otherwise, level of gray
